question.text:
Assertion (A): The film which appears bright in reflected system will appear dark in the transmitted system and vice-versa.

Reason (R): The conditions for film to appear bright or dark in the reflected light are just reverse to those in the transmitted light

options.text: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mfenced> <mtext>A</mtext> </mfenced></mrow> </math> is true and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mfenced> <mtext>R</mtext> </mfenced></mrow> </math> is true and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mfenced> <mtext>R</mtext> </mfenced></mrow> </math> is the correct explanation of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mfenced> <mtext>A</mtext> </mfenced></mrow> </math>.

<math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mfenced> <mtext>A</mtext> </mfenced></mrow> </math> and <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mfenced> <mtext>R</mtext> </mfenced></mrow> </math> are true but <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mfenced> <mtext>R</mtext> </mfenced></mrow> </math> is not the correct explanation of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mrow> <mfenced> <mtext>A</mtext> </mfenced></mrow> </math>

solution.text: For reflected system of the film, the consition for maxima is <math><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">cos</mi></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi><mo>=</mo><mfenced separators="|"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mfenced></mrow></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">λ</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></math> . While the maxima for transmitted system of film is <math><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">μ</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">t</mi><mrow><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">cos</mi></mrow><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">r</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">n</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">λ</mi></math> and is reverse for minima. A & R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
